children.name: silent b2
children.definition: silentadjectiveno speaking im lặng, không nói, làm thinh
examples: without talking
_she whispered a silent prayer that her wounded brother would not die.
_the police officer told the criminal that he hadthe right to remainsilent.
_the minister was silenton/abouthis plans for the future.
_arthur has always been thestrong,silenttype(= a
type of person, usually a man, who says very little) .
_ the report is silent on that point bản báo cáo không nói gì về điểm đó
_ to keep silent cứ làm thinh

children.name: tight-lipped x
children.definition: tight-lippedunwilling to talk about sth : mím chặt môi
examples: tight-lipped about
he's been very tight-lipped about what happened at the meeting.
diplomats are remaining tight-lipped about the negotiations.

children.name: wordless x
children.definition: wordless without using wordssyn silent:
examples: a wordless prayer
she threw her arms around him in wordless grief.
wordlesslyadverb:
she nodded wordlessly.

children.name: keep your gob shut b2
children.definition: 2 keep your mouth shutinformal
examples: a)to not tell other people about a secret :
he demanded £2,000 to keep his mouth shut.
b)to not say something even if you think it :
i wished that i’d kept my mouth shut.

children.name: silence b1
children.definition: silencenounno speaking sự im lặng; sự nín thinh
examples: [ u ] a state of not speaking or writing or making a noise
_the soldiers listenedinsilence as their captain gave the orders.
_"silence (= stop talking) " shouted the teacher.
_my request for help wasmet withsilence (= i received no answer) .
_her silenceon/aboutwhat had
happened to her surprised everyone.
_their mother's angry wordsreducedthe childrentosilence.
_i don't expect to hear from her now, after three years' silence
(= three years in which she has not spoken or written to me) .

children.name: when people who have argued do not talk to each other
not be talking a1
children.definition: not be talking/speaking không nói chuyện
examples: ▪ ‘have you seen tim lately?’ ‘no, we’re not talking at the moment.’
▪ when claire and andy aren’t speaking, she usually calls me up to complain.

children.name: not be on speaking terms c2
children.definition: not be on speaking terms if two people are not on speaking terms, their relationship has become so unfriendly that they refuse to talk to each other: không còn nói chuyện
examples: she wasn’t on speaking terms with rachel for several weeks afterwards.
by the end of the year, the two old friends were no longer on speaking terms.

children.name: send sb to coventry x
children.definition: send somebody to coventry british if a group of people send someone to coventry, they refuse to talk to that person as a way of punishing them for something: phớt lờ
examples: ▪ i don’t know why they won’t talk to me. i didn’t know i’d been sent to coventry.
▪ when he refused to join the strike, joe’s mates sent him to coventry for three weeks.

children.name: the silent treatment x
children.definition: the silent treatment when one person does not talk to another person, usually to show that they are angry:
examples: ▪ my sister tried the silent treatment on me, but i just ignored her.give somebody the silent treatment
▪ on the ride home, vance’s father gave him the silent treatment.

children.name: go quiet a2
children.definition: go quiet /gəʊ ˈkwaɪət/  trở nên im lặng
examples: ▪ she was happy to talk about her school and friends, but when i asked her about her parents, she went quiet.
▪ gerard suddenly realized that the people at the next table had gone quiet and were staring at them.

children.name: break off b2
children.definition: break off to suddenly stop talking without finishing what you were saying: ngừng nói
examples: ▪ ‘it’s not that i wanted to...’ he broke off and sighed.
▪ kathleen was just telling me about her new car when she suddenly broke off and ran to the window.
break off sth
▪ i was sorry to break off his conversation with margaret, but i had to leave.

children.name: fall silent b2
children.definition: fall silent written to suddenly stop talking, especially because sth has happened to make you feel afraid, sad etc: rơi vào im lặng
examples: ▪ ‘explain yourself,’ mr o'conner demanded. paul fell silent, staring hard at the floor.
▪ everyone in the room fell silent, and miss rogers dozed peacefully her chair.

children.name: spoken: tell sb to stop talking
be quiet a2
children.definition: be quiet/biː ˈkwaɪət/ spoken say this when you want someone to stop talking: hãy im lặng, im đi
examples: ▪ please be quiet for a moment.
▪ be quiet - i’m on the phone.
▪ just be quiet and let me finish the story.

children.name: quiet down a2
children.definition: quiet downspoken say this when you want a group of people, especially a group you are in charge of, to stop talking: im lặng đi
examples: all right, everybody, quiet down - we’re about to stop.
quiet down! i can’t hear the tv.

children.name: silence b1
children.definition: silenceformal spoken used in formal situations, especially by someone in authority to tell people to be completely quiet: hãy im lặng
examples: ▪ silence in court!
▪ silence! will you please let the honourable member finish what he is saying.

children.name: shut up b2
children.definition: shut up/ˌʃʌt ˈʌp/ spoken say this to rudely tell someone to stop talking: im đi, câm đi
examples: ▪ just shut up and listen to me.
▪ hey, shut up down there! we’re trying to sleep.
▪ no one wants to listen to you - why don’t you shut up and sit down

children.name: to not talk about a particular subject
not talk about a1
children.definition: not talk about/nɒt ˈtɔːk əbaʊt/  không nói về
examples: ▪ it’s been three months, but he won’t talk about the accident.
▪ she doesn’t talk about her husband half as much as she did when he first died.
▪ i don’t know what my parents think about my living here - we never talk about it.

children.name: not say anything about a1
children.definition: not say anything about/nɒt seɪ ˈeniθɪŋ əˌbaʊt/  to not talk about sth, because it could be embarrassing or difficult, or just because you did not think about talking about it: không nói điều gì về
examples: ▪ didn’t she say anything about the party?
▪ don’t say anything about the divorce - it will only upset her.
▪ the company’s policy is not to say anything about former employees other than to give their period of employment.

children.name: not mention b1
children.definition: not mention/nɒt ˈmenʃən/  to not talk about something, even for a short time or carelessly: không đề cập
examples: ▪ we were careful not to mention her son’s legal problems.
▪ he doesn’t mention cathy anymore when he writes - i wonder if they broke up?
not mention (that) không đề cập rằng
▪ i didn’t mention that we were going to the movies in front of john.

children.name: keep off x
children.definition: keep off the subject/ question of sth to deliberately not talk about something, especially because the subject could be embarrassing or difficult: tránh xa vấn đề, câu hỏi liên quan gì đó
examples: i normally keep off the subject of ex-girlfriends on a first date.
unless the interviewer asks you directly, keep off the question of why you left your last job.

children.name: drop it c2
children.definition: drop the subject/drop it to deliberately stop talking about a particular subject, especially because it is embarrassing, upsetting, or annoying sb: ngưng cái đề tài ấy lại
examples: ▪ ‘you’ll never get me to believe that!’ she screeched, so i just nodded and dropped the subject.
▪ can we just drop the subject? i’m sick of hearing about it.
▪ look, just drop it, ok? i understood you the first time.

children.name: steer clear of c2
children.definition: steer clear of to deliberately not talk about sth, especially because the subject could be embarrassing or difficult: tránh xa, lánh xa
examples: we try to steer clear of controversial issues in the workshops.
her press agent asked the interviewer to steer clear of questions about her love life.

children.name: keep silent b2
children.definition: keep silent about/ keep quiet aboutc2 to not talk about an event or situation from the past for a long time, especially because it is very difficult to talk about: giữ im lặng về
examples: he had kept silent about the murder for ten years before he went to the police.
they said they’d kill her if she didn’t keep quiet about what she’d seen.
davies kept quiet about the amount of money being spent.
keep sth quiet
she managed to keep the operation quiet for a while.

children.name: gloss over x
children.definition: gloss over if you gloss over unpleasant facts, you deliberately avoid talking about them or you only mention them quickly and without giving much detail: nói qua loa
examples: it seems to me he was glossing over some major risks of the plan.
in a job interview you should highlight your strengths and gloss over your weaknesses.

children.name: silent b2
children.definition: silent/ˈsaɪlənt/  especially written not speaking: im lặng
examples: ▪ phil was silent for a moment as he thought about his reply.
remain silent
▪ i wanted to say ‘please don’t go’, but instead i remained silent, and she left.
fall silent
▪ the woman fell silent, though she kept darting angry glances at jessica

children.name: be lost for words x
children.definition: be lost for words / be at a loss for words to be unable to say anything because you are very surprised or because you are not prepared for the situation that has suddenly happened: không nói nên lời
examples: ▪ no matter what happens he never seems lost for words.
▪ she stared at his letter, clearly at a loss for words.

children.name: be struck dumb x
children.definition: be struck dumb to be suddenly unable to say anything because you are extremely surprised or shocked and cannot believe what has happened: lặng người, chết lặng
examples: ▪ amy was struck dumb. was it possible that her own son had deceived her?
be struck dumb with
▪ when he arrived at the scene of the disaster, he was struck dumb with horror and amazement.

children.name: clam up x
children.definition: clam up informal to suddenly become unwilling to talk: câm như hến
examples: he always clams up when i ask him about his job - do you think he’s doing something illegal?
the police took her in for questioning, but she clammed up when they asked about her boyfriend.

children.name: speechless c1
children.definition: speechless unable to say anything because you are very angry, surprised, or upset: không nói nên lời
examples: ▪ anna was speechless. she had never seen such luxury before.
speechless with
▪ laura stared at him, absolutely speechless with rage.
leave/render somebody speechlessmake someone speechless
▪ his words dented her pride and left her speechless.

children.name: tongue-tied x
children.definition: tongue-tied unable to talk in a relaxed way because you feel nervous or embarrassed : trẹo lưỡi
examples: she became tongue-tied when she looked at the handsome man sitting beside her.
nervousness affects people in different ways. while some people become tongue-tied, others cannot stop talking.
when adults spoke to her, she became tongue-tied and shy.

children.name: i don’t know what to say u
children.definition: i don’t know what to sayspoken say this when sb gives you an unexpected present, or does sth bad or shocking, and you cannot express how happy, angry etc you feel: không biết phải nói gì
examples: you’re so kind! i don’t know what to say.
well, i don’t know what to say. it’s absolutely disgraceful!

children.name: words fail me x
children.definition: words fail mespoken say this when you are so shocked or angry that you cannot think of anything to say to express how you feel: không biết phải nói gì
examples: ▪ just look at this mess. look at it. it’s...words fail me!

children.name: bite your tongue x
children.definition: bite your tongue to not say anything even though you want very much to say what you think: cắn lưỡi (để nhịn không nói ra)
examples: ▪ i had to bite my tongue to stop myself telling neil exactly what i thought of his stupid plan.
▪ she’s so temperamental that even if you disagree with her it’s better to bite your tongue and say nothing.
